channel.title: Yet Another Pretender rework
channel.description:
**Pretender Neutral Special** **False Identity** (Passive) - Immune to death once, this passive is removed upon class changing. **Stolen Actions** (Passive) - You'll gain the amount of limited use abilites they had left. **Tailor** (Night) - If that target is killed during the night you’ll become that class - Infinite. **Double Dress** (Night) - Select two targets, if one is killed you’ll become that class, if both are killed you’ll become the first one you select. - 2 uses
Goal: Become a new class and complete their objectives.
Notes (Strange interactions).
[details="Summary"] -If possessor jumps, Pretender will not become the class of the jumped. -Can't become reaped targets. -(Debate if you think they should be able to become classes that where jailed). -Will bypass assassin or second cult member on become the CL/MM when they die. -Being debbed into a dead king will not become king, Pretender can never become king unless stepping up. [/details]

item.title: Yet Another Pretender rework
item.dc:creator: katze
item.description:
Soulshade55r:

Alchemist wants scum out as soon as possible for the quickest win sam-ish with pret I feel like my argument still stands

I guess it works both ways. In my eyes, letting Prince die as Alchemist is optimal. But I suppose if you want scum out ASAP, Prince staying around is good. But by letting BD die the game ends pretty fast, but you do have more chances to die… guess my own playstyle isn’t optimal hehehe

Pretender is weird. I don’t like debating Pretender because I really do think they need a massive rework. But as it stands, Pretender is pretty BD sided. Pretender King usually favors scum, but not always.

Soulshade55r:

Maybe we could change it to not be able to copy unique-Bd classes, I think it becoming classes like Sellsword/Assassin would be good if it wasn’t able to remeber evil unique classes it would be mega bd sided. as the only real evils that aren’t unique is Fool(This is even debatable), Non-CL cult and third unseen members

I could sort of agree with that. Not being able to copy Prince allows for a lot more diversity, because copying Prince would be optimal more times than not.

I do have concerns with copying cultseen and the faction cap, having a 3rd potential MM, etc etc. Having a third MM seems pretty insane, after all. Dno how others would feel about that.

Soulshade55r:

Not to burst your bubble but the point was the optimal play would be to wait to see who’s likely to win yes bd win more often, this is why I wanted this class to target jailed players ect. Maybe even execution targets but that might be overkill. But bd only win like 45% of the time cult and unseen have a pretty high win ratio and if you think one sides going to lose it’s always optiomally best to side with the other side as any neutral.

If this Pretender could copy the Prince, then I still think copying Prince would be optimal most of the time. But lets assume they can’t.

I said most of what I said before without considering it’s one time death immunity, with that it can safely think about what to copy for a bit. Probably 3-4 nights. In that case, you’d absolutely be correct. Optimally you just try to side with whoevers winning and let them snowball even more. The problem being you have to pick the right person in the right night… unless

this is why I wanted this class to target jailed players ect. Maybe even execution targets but that might be overkill.

Execution targets is definitely overkill… jailed targets though… just maybe.
